headline.main: BRITAIN CONFIDENT OVER DARDANELLES; Hears Italians Sought Right of Passage for Warships -- Turks Not Receptive

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 18 (AP) -- An authoritative source said today that reports had been received of an Italian attempt to pass warships through the Turkish-controlled Dardanelles under the Bulgarian flag and that Sir Hughe M. Knatchbull-Hugessen, British Ambassador to Ankara, "probably" had made representations against this proposal to the Turkish Government.
abstract: Brit reaction to reptd Turkish refusal to Permit Itals to pass Bulgarian warships through Dardanelles-Polish Premier Sikorski to visit USSR to inspect Polish troops
